basics.name: Crystal Hansen
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: A creative developer that bridges user experience and backend logic — all guided by clean, scaleable, modular code principles with a strong foundation in backend systems, data flow, modular architecture  and a focus on scalability, security, and performance.

work.name: Crystal Hansen Artographic
work.summary: Full-stack portfolio and booking platform for a professional photographer. Built with a custom React frontend and dual backend architecture for both development and production environments.
highlights: React (Vite + TypeScript) frontend
Node.js + Express server with cron jobs
PHP API integration for live production
Dynamic galleries, bookings, and product listings
SEO optimization with React Helmet and .htaccess routing

work.name: PGSTECH
work.summary: Full-stack development of internal and public-facing platforms for a technology consultancy using PHP, Drupal, and modern cloud tools. Led key integrations, migrations, and performance improvements.
highlights: Developed and maintained emtp.com using PHP with performance/security best practices
Coded HubSpot and website data migrations with SEO Optimizations and URL consistency
Integrated HubSpot APIs, Brevo API, PayPal gateway with Drupal
Built custom modules for file handling, star ratings, and subscriptions
Resolved caching issues and enhanced Drupal API performance
Key projects: Drupal CMS migration, CRM migration, Star Rating System, Brevo API Integration, Advertising API

work.name: Crystal Hansen Artographic
work.summary: Freelance SaaS and booking platforms with Angular, Java, Spring Boot, and cloud technologies. Delivered complete apps from UI to backend and integrations.
highlights: Studio Booking & Rentals SaaS using Angular, Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate
Gallery & Portfolio platform with Angular and Java backend
Dynamic Gallery with lazy-loading image grids
Python-based screen scraper for industry data analysis
Integrated calendar views and real-time backend processing

work.name: Canadian Western Bank
work.position: Manager, Risk Technology and Model Deployment
work.summary: Led full-stack development of in-house scorecard applications for credit risk modeling and business process management. Oversaw sprint planning, systems analysis, and agile development for internal tools.
highlights: Built web-based applications for credit risk scoring with Java, Angular, SAS, and SQL
Led sprint cycles, demonstrations, and stakeholder buy-in using Agile methodology
Integrated backend and frontend components in risk dashboards and workflow systems
Designed vision boards and storytelling artifacts for application planning
Managed appointment systems, reminders, and timeline tracking tools

work.name: Canadian Western Bank
work.summary: Designed web applications to calculate and manage obligor risk using responsive and intuitive interfaces. Focused on front-to-back integration, usability, and application logic for credit risk modeling.
highlights: Developed risk scorecard applications (IPRE, SME, SBE, LargeCorp) using Angular and JavaScript
Managed full lifecycle of Cerberus default management system (Struts, Angular)
Built Java-based work tracking and reporting systems (SAS, CSS, REST)
Applied usability testing and responsive UX design to simplify user interactions
Documented functional specs, tracked bugs, and maintained iterative improvements

work.name: Canadian Western Bank
work.summary: Developed internal tools and led data transformation initiatives for banking systems migration, including integrations with third-party systems and regulatory data compliance.
highlights: Built tools for message logging, interface error handling, and transformation logic
Led T24 Banking System migration using SQL Server SSIS, DDL/DML transformations
Created CRM and financial data models for Verafin, ISO, Central 1 integrations
Performed test-driven gap analysis and built custom reports from customer datasets
Worked in Java, .NET (VB.NET, C#), Powershell, and Excel for ETL/DevOps tasks

work.name: Canadian Western Bank
work.summary: Supported internal client systems with .NET and Java solutions, including legacy modernization and data transformation across multiple DBMS platforms.
highlights: Modified and maintained .NET applications for internal workflows
Converted legacy systems and supported risk compliance requirements
Handled cross-platform data migration between MS SQL, MySQL, and Oracle
Key projects: CWBCareers (.NET, VB), INFOServer (.NET 3.5, C#), Wave (JavaScript, Java), SharePoint plugins

education.institution: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology, Edmonton, Alberta
University of Alberta  - Extension, Edmonton, Alberta

education.area: Desktop Publishing Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services

awards.title: Q3 2017 Pillars of Excellence Nominees
awards.summary: Pillar of Excellence award is offered by CWB as a nomination platform by its employees to acknowledge one another on exceptional performance.

skills.name: Computer Sciences
keywords: Programming Languages: Java, Node.js, Python, PHP, .NET (C#, VB), Flask, Express
Web Development: Angular / React / TypeScript / JSX / HTML5, CSS3, JS, BS5, RxJS
Backend & APIs: Drupal/PHP,  WebAPI, Spring - MVC, Boot, Hibernate, JDBC, RESTful APIs, WebAPIs,ChatGPT API,PHP API, SOAP
Database Management: MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, MariaDB, SAS EG, RDS, ETL Migrations
Content Management & Migrations: Drupal, WordPress, custom modules, SEO Optimization, Google Search Console, GTM, LinkedIn/Google Ads
Server & Deployment: Tomcat, Catalina, Apache, Nginx, Docker, Ubuntu, Unix, Linux, EC2
DevOps & CI/CD: Git, GitHub, GitLab, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, TFS, Drush, Composer, CI/CD pipelines, Agile methodologies
Security & Optimization: DKIM, SPF, OAuth, Basic Authentication, Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

projects.name: Artog.co
projects.summary: Social media and operations platform for photographers, models, and creatives to collaborate, schedule, and manage portfolios and workflows.
highlights: Role-Based Access (RBA)
Photography CMS
Drupal
Social networking features
Booking workflows

projects.name: Pinmento
projects.summary: Geolocation-based journaling web app built with a Drupal front end. Enables users to drop pins on a Google Map and attach journal entries, fostering memory mapping and reflective exploration.
highlights: Drupal theming
Google Maps JavaScript API
Pin-drop journaling
Geospatial content management

projects.name: Studio Booker
projects.summary: Angular-based booking system to simulate real-world appointment scheduling and checkout using session state.
highlights: Angular 17
Session state cart
Time slot management
PDF confirmation & checkout

projects.name: Happy2Be
projects.summary: Java Spring Boot application focused on mood analysis and positive reinforcement through conversational prompts. Expands emotional intelligence in AI by analyzing sentiment polarity and providing feedback.
highlights: Java Spring Boot
Sentiment Analysis
Conversational Prompts
Positive Reinforcement AI

projects.name: Fortune-ai
projects.summary: Microservice chatbot designed for playful, fortune-style prompts using natural language responses. Focused on GPT integration and simple Java Spring Boot API deployment. Deployed to AWS for accessible querying.
highlights: Java Spring Boot
Prompt-to-Fortune Generator
AWS Deployment
REST API

projects.name: Oribie AI front end of (Fortune-AI)
projects.summary: Frontend integration of a Java-based AI microservice that delivers fortune-telling and emotionally intelligent prompts, embedded into the Pinmento website via JavaScript and PHP.
highlights: Drupal frontend integration
JavaScript Fetch API
Spring Boot backend (Java)
Emotion-aware prompt rendering
PHP-based API handling
Embedded chatbot UI
OpenAI GPT integration

projects.name: Sales Data Trend Generator
projects.summary: Python-based tool for generating simulated photography sales data. Designed to support Drupal dashboard testing and realistic UI rendering during prototyping stages.
highlights: Python Flask microservice for trend simulation
Mock sales data generation for time-series
Supports Drupal dashboard prototypes
Github integrated for CLI use and CI/CD

projects.name: Bookit App Platform
projects.summary: Modernized version of a 2019 booking system with full rebuild into a Spring Boot and Maven-based Java platform. Supports calendar slotting, cart, and checkout processes. Deployed to AWS for accessible querying.
highlights: Java, Spring Boot, Spring MVC backend
Refactored from Angular.js legacy code
Calendar bookings + cart system
Centralized booking API for external websites
AWS EC2 and RDS deployment + Google Cloud integration
